articles.title: Kamal Nath resigns as Leader of Opposition in Madhya Pradesh - The Indian Express
articles.description: Kamal Nath, who is also the state Congress president since 2018, took over as Leader of Opposition after his 15-month-long government fell on March 20, 2020 with the exit of Jyotiraditya Scindia and his 25 loyalist MLAs.
articles.content: AFTER MORE than two years as Leader of Opposition in Madhya Pradesh Assembly, former chief minister Kamal Nath Thursday stepped down as leader of Congress Legislature Party (CLP). The party named sev… [+1322 chars]

articles.title: Polls 2023: Shivraj Singh Chouhan back in favour for MP but BJP may go without CM face in Chhattisgarh - The Indian Express
articles.description: The rift-ridden Chhattisgarh unit has not shown any sign of revival, with one faction alleging that the dominant faction led by former chief minister Raman Singh is calling the shots without taking others into confidence.

articles.description: Russian strikes slammed into Kiev on Thursday evening as UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was visiting in the first such bombardment of Ukraine's capital since mid-April, the president's office and AFP correspondents said.

articles.title: India Cancels Some Passenger Trains To Make Way For Coal To Avoid Power Crises | Mint - Mint
articles.description: Currently, many regions in India have witnessed long hours of blackouts, while some industries are trimming their output due to shortages in fossil fuel - which has created a threat to the economy’s revival from the pandemic-led slump.
articles.content:
To avoid full-blown power crises, India has canceled some passenger trains to enable faster movement of coal carriages as the country struggles to restock depleting inventories at power plants.
